channel.title: Home Changeing
channel.description: On my source the home is set at Fally how do i change to edge :D Thanks

item.title: Home Changeing
item.dc:creator: @killerkody killerkody
item.description:
@killerkody wrote:

Why is it that people can’t just google such simple things. When I started my server I went straight to google. You should be coming here for more harder things like custom codes.

If you can’t get this I will be online all day just message me and Il teach you step by step… I will only tell you what to do!

@202685 wrote:

[quote=“r0m3r0, post:8, topic:429149”][quote author=xI c E link=topic=531844.msg3886634#msg3886634 date=1326498821]

Just give up now. If you can’t even type in “google.com” into your address bar, just give up.

Theres so many “tuts” on it. I wouldn’t even call it a tut considering it’s so simple.

I’d call it a special-Ed. Tut.

Or what most people like to call a snippet.

There’s no need to be a dick.
[/quote]
agreed[/quote]
some one needs to get laid

Read full topic

item.title: Home Changeing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If you just want to have the player set there on their first connection, all you have to do is change the location

final Location home = new Location(edgevilleX, edgevillY);
player.setLocation(home);

However, if you want to move EVERYTHING to Edgeville, it will be a bit more complicated. You would have to not only change their home location (like example A), but you would also have to change where the Npcs spawn, and where the objects are placed.

Read full topic

item.title: Home Changeing
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

you need to find the home tele coordinates and replace them with the edgeville coordinates in client.java
NOTE: you will have to move anything from old home to new home

Read full topic

item.title: Home Changeing
item.dc:creator: @r0m3r0 r0m3r0
item.description:
@r0m3r0 wrote:

[code]Do ::mypos in-game and go into player.java i believe search for the coords you got inside player.java and change them… for the npc’s go into autospawn.cfg and edit their coords there

if you don’t already have the ::mypos command here it is:

if(command.startsWith("mypos") && playerRights > 0){
sM("AbsX: "+absX+" AbsY: "+absY+"");
}[/code]

if you can't figure out how to edit the coords just make a new command called home such as this one:

[code=]if(command.startsWith("home") && playerRights >= 0){//the command itself
if (inCombat) {//if in combat it won't let you use you can just delete this and the sM(".....") part and the } else { part if you don't want it 
sM("Please wait until you are out of combat.");//msg telling you that your in combat and it wont let you tele
} else {//if not in combat
toX = ####;x coord
toY = ####;y coord
sendInterface("Welcome back to "+playerName+".");//shows interface welcoming player back
}
}

i would post a link to various tutorials that would help you but its of another rsps community… anyways hope i helped

Read full topic
